ground_truth: Potter is now behind his desk. He spreads the newspaper out in front of him, muttering as he does so. He sees the envelope, looks inside at the money. Then, to his goon, indicating the office door. Potter opens the door just a little, and peers through into the bank. He starts thumping his pockets, with increasing panic, and looks in the waste paper basket on the floor. Uncle Billy looks around for the money envelope. He looks puzzled, thinks hard, then a look of concern creeps into his eyes. He finally rushes through the door and out into the street. The goon wheels him back to his desk. He is deep in thought, with a crafty expression on his face. Uncle Billy running across the street in the direction of the Building and Loan. George coming from room where he has just left the bank examiner. He sees Violet Bick standing there. He hears a noise, and sees Uncle Billy entering the office. Uncle Billy comes hurrying in. Uncle Billy picks up the phone and speaks distractedly, without knowing what he is saying. He hangs up agitatedly, muttering to himself as he goes into his own office. Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace look after him, dumbfounded. George has just finished writing something, and is slipping the paper into an envelope. She looks at him, then says a strange thing. She reaches up and kisses him on the cheek, leaving lipstick. George opens the door for her. As George and Violet come through the door, they are being watched by Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace and the bank examiner, who is still waiting to go to work on the books. Violet sees the lipstick on George's cheek, and dabs at it with her handkerchief. She exits. As George opens the door he sees Uncle Billy frantically looking for the missing envelope. The office is in a mess, drawers are opened, and papers scattered on the floor and on the desk. George stops short, suddenly aware of the tragic old eyes looking up at him. Uncle Billy gestures nervously for George to come in. He does so and closes the door. Cousin Tilly is at her switchboard, and Cousin Eustace standing beside her. Suddenly the door opens and George comes striding out. He goes directly to the safe and starts searching, but doesn't find the money. Then he goes to the cash drawer in the counter, and looks through it. Carter is still waiting in the doorway to his office. Cousin Eustace runs over to George. Uncle Billy and George are retracing the former's steps through the snow, looking everywhere for the missing money. They pause for a moment on the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Potter is now behind his bureau. He spreads the gazette out in front of him, muttering as he does so. He sees the packet, looks inside at the cash. Then, to his thug, indicating the workplace portal. Potter opens the portal just a little, and peers through into the depository. He starts thumping his pouches, with increasing panic, and looks in the waste paper receptacle on the floor. Uncle Billy looks around for the cash packet. He looks puzzled, thinks hard, then a look of concern creeps into his eyes. He finally rushes through the portal and out into the street. The thug wheels him back to his bureau. He is deep in thought, with a crafty expression on his face. Uncle Billy running across the street in the direction of the Establishment and Loan. George coming from chamber where he has just left the bank examiner. He sees Violet Bick standing there. He hears a sound, and sees Uncle Billy entering the workplace. Uncle Billy comes hurrying in. Uncle Billy picks up the telephone and speaks distractedly, without knowing what he is saying. He hangs up agitatedly, muttering to himself as he goes into his own workplace. Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace look after him, dumbfounded. George has just finished writing something, and is slipping the paper into a packet. She looks at him, then says a strange thing. She reaches up and kisses him on the cheek, leaving lipstick. George opens the portal for her. As George and Violet come through the portal, they are being watched by Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace and the bank examiner, who is still waiting to go to labor on the ledgers. Violet sees the lipstick on George's cheek, and dabs at it with her handkerchief. She exits. As George opens the portal he sees Uncle Billy frantically looking for the missing packet. The workplace is in a mess, drawers are opened, and papers scattered on the floor and on the bureau. George stops short, suddenly aware of the tragic old eyes looking up at him. Uncle Billy gestures nervously for George to come in. He does so and closes the portal. Cousin Tilly is at her switchboard, and Cousin Eustace standing beside her. Suddenly the portal opens and George comes striding out. He goes directly to the safe and starts searching, but doesn't find the cash. Then he goes to the cash drawer in the counter, and looks through it. Carter is still waiting in the doorway to his workplace. Cousin Eustace runs over to George. Uncle Billy and George are retracing the former's steps through the snow, looking everywhere for the missing cash. They pause for a moment on the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Potter is now behind his desk. The newspaper is spread out in front of him by Potter, who mutters as it is done. The envelope is seen by him, and the money inside is looked at. Then, he indicates the office door to his goon. The door is opened just a little by Potter, and he peers through into the bank. His pockets are thumped by him with increasing panic, and the waste paper basket on the floor is looked in. The money envelope is looked for by Uncle Billy. He seems puzzled, thinks hard, then a look of concern creeps into his eyes. The door is finally rushed through by him, and he runs out into the street. The goon wheels him back to his desk. A crafty expression is on his face, showing he is deep in thought. Uncle Billy runs across the street in the direction of the Building and Loan. George comes from the room where the bank examiner has just been left by him. Violet Bick is seen standing there by him. A noise is heard by him, and he sees Uncle Billy entering the office. Uncle Billy hurries in. The phone is picked up by Uncle Billy and he speaks distractedly, without knowing what is being said by him. He agitatedly hangs up, muttering to himself as his own office is entered by him. Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace look after him, dumbfounded. George has just finished writing something, and an envelope is slipped into by him with the paper. She looks at him, then a strange thing is said by her. He is reached up to and kissed on the cheek by her, leaving lipstick. The door is opened for her by George. As the door is come through by George and Violet, they are watched by Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace, and the bank examiner, who waits to work on the books. The lipstick on George's cheek is seen by Violet, and she dabs at it with her handkerchief. She exits. As the door is opened by George, Uncle Billy is seen frantically looking for the missing envelope. The office is in a mess, drawers are opened, and papers are scattered on the floor and on the desk. George stops short, suddenly aware of the tragic old eyes that look up at him. Uncle Billy nervously gestures for George to come in. That is done and the door is closed by him. Cousin Tilly is at her switchboard, and Cousin Eustace stands beside her. Suddenly, the door is opened, and George strides out. The safe is gone to directly by him and searched, but the money isn't found. Then, he goes to the cash drawer in the counter, and it is looked through by him. Carter is still waiting in the doorway to his office. George is run over to by Cousin Eustace. The former's steps through the snow are retraced by Uncle Billy and George, looking everywhere for the missing money. They pause for a moment on the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Potter sits behind his desk, spreading the newspaper out, muttering. He notices the envelope and checks the money inside. He signals his goon and cracks the office door to peer into the bank, patting his pockets in panic and checking the wastebasket. Uncle Billy searches for the money envelope, looks puzzled, then worried, and rushes outside. Returned to his desk by the goon, he thinks craftily. Uncle Billy runs toward the Building and Loan while George exits a room, encountering Violet Bick. Hearing noise, George sees Uncle Billy enter, hurriedly talking on the phone without knowing what he's saying, then agitatedly heads to his office. Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace watch, surprised. George finishes writing, slips the paper into an envelope; she kisses his cheek, leaving lipstick, and exits as George opens the door. Tilly, Eustace, and the bank examiner watch. Violet wipes George's cheek with her handkerchief. George sees Uncle Billy frantically searching for the envelope in the messy office and goes in. Tilly and Eustace stay at the switchboard, while George strides out, searches the safe, and checks the cash drawer. Carter waits in the doorway. Eustace runs to George, who retraces Uncle Billy's steps in the snow, searching for the missing money, pausing on the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Potter sits at his desk, spreads the newspaper, muttering. He sees the money envelope, checks inside, signals his goon to open the office door slightly, and peers into the bank. Searching his pockets and the wastebasket, Uncle Billy realizes the money is missing and rushes out. The goon returns him to his desk, looking crafty. Billy races towards the Building and Loan where George, leaving the bank examiner, encounters Violet Bick. Billy enters, distractedly speaking into the phone and muttering as he retreats to his office, with Cousin Tilly and Eustace confused. George slips a note into an envelope; Violet kisses him, leaving lipstick. She wipes the lipstick as she exits, while Billy frantically searches for the missing envelope amidst chaos. George, aware of Billy's distress, closes the door. Tilly at her switchboard and Eustace watch as George searches the safe and cash drawer, finding nothing. Carter awaits as Uncle Billy and George retrace steps in the snow, searching for the money.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Potter is now situated behind his imposing desk, a position of authority and contemplation. He meticulously spreads the newspaper out in front of him, all the while muttering under his breath, as if these quiet words would bring clarity. His eyes land on an envelope, which he carefully examines, peeking inside to confirm the presence of money. Then, turning his attention to his loyal goon, he gestures subtly, indicating towards the office door, hinting at a deeper plan. Carefully, Potter eases the door open just a crack, stealing a glance into the bustling bank beyond. Amid this, he starts patting his pockets, first with mild concern, which quickly escalates to a desperate panic, as if something crucial has gone missing. In his mounting anxiety, he checks the waste paper basket on the floor, a last resort in his search. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy is also searching, casting around frantically for the money envelope. A puzzled expression etches across his face, and he pauses, thinking hard, trying to retrace his steps. Suddenly, a look of deep concern clouds his eyes, and realizing the gravity of the situation, he bursts through the door and rushes out into the street. 

The goon, ever watchful, returns him to his desk, where Potter sits deep in thought, a crafty expression dancing across his features. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy, fueled by urgency, is seen sprinting across the street towards the Building and Loan. George, having just departed from a meeting with the bank examiner, emerges from the room, when his eyes land on Violet Bick standing nearby. His attention is then drawn away by a noise, and Uncle Billy's hurried entrance into the office. Uncle Billy, flustered and distracted, picks up the phone, speaking incoherently, the words hardly registering. He then hangs up agitatedly, muttering to himself as he retreats into his own office space, leaving Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace watching him with dumbfounded expressions, struggling to comprehend the situation. George, having just completed a task, is seen slipping a piece of paper into an envelope, an action observed by an onlooker. This observer makes a move, suddenly saying something unexpected, before reaching up to place a soft kiss, leaving a trace of lipstick on his cheek. George, ever the gentleman, opens the door for her. 

As George and Violet move through the doorway together, they are subtly scrutinized by the attentive eyes of Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace, and the patiently waiting bank examiner, who is ready to dive back into the books. Violet notices the lipstick mark on George's cheek and gently dabs it away with her handkerchief before making her exit. As George reopens the door, he encounters Uncle Billy, who is frantically searching for the elusive envelope. The office is in a state of disarray, with drawers pulled open and papers strewn haphazardly across the floor and desk, evidence of the frantic search. George halts abruptly, suddenly recognizing the deep, troubled gaze of Uncle Billy, who looks up at him with tragic old eyes. Uncle Billy, with nervous gestures, beckons George to enter. George complies, closing the door behind him to maintain privacy. Meanwhile, Cousin Tilly is stationed at her switchboard, with Cousin Eustace standing close by, observing the unfolding drama. 

In a sudden burst of energy, the door flies open and George strides out with determination. He makes his way directly to the safe, searching with a sense of urgency, but his efforts yield no results as the money remains elusive. Undeterred, he moves to the cash drawer within the counter, rifling through it in a last-ditch effort. Carter, steadfast and patient, remains standing in the doorway to his office, observing the proceedings. Cousin Eustace darts over to assist George. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy and George are seen retracing Uncle Billy's previous steps through the snow, meticulously searching every corner for the missing money. They pause momentarily on the sidewalk, sharing a brief exchange as the gravity of their predicament weighs heavily on them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Potter, now comfortably settled behind his large and imposing desk, occupies a position that exudes both authority and contemplative thought. With deliberate care, he spreads the newspaper out meticulously in front of him, his fingers smoothing the pages as he mutters softly under his breath, as if these quiet words might somehow dispel confusion and bring about much-needed clarity. His keen eyes soon focus on an envelope, which he scrutinizes with great care, peeking inside to confirm, with satisfaction, the presence of money. Shifting his attention, he gestures subtly to his ever-loyal goon, a silent indication toward the office door, suggesting the inception of a more intricate plan. With careful precision, Potter eases the door open just a crack, stealing a strategic glance into the bustling activity of the bank beyond. Amidst this scene, he begins patting his pockets with a mild concern that quickly escalates into a desperate panic, as though something vitally important has vanished. In a state of mounting anxiety, he checks the waste paper basket on the floor, resorting to this last-ditch effort in his frantic search. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy is engaged in his own frantic search, casting about in a desperate attempt to locate the critical money envelope. A puzzled expression becomes evident on his face as he pauses, thinking hard, trying to bring back the memory of his previous actions. A look of deep concern suddenly clouds his eyes as he comprehends the gravity of the situation, prompting him to rush out through the door and onto the street.  

The goon, ever watchful and diligent, guides him back to his desk, where Potter remains consumed by thought, a crafty expression playing across his features. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy, propelled by a sense of urgency, is seen making a determined sprint across the street, heading straight towards the Building and Loan. George, emerging from a recent meeting with the bank examiner, catches sight of Violet Bick standing nearby. However, his attention is soon diverted by a noise, and by Uncle Billy's hasty entrance into the office. Uncle Billy, flustered and visibly distracted, picks up the phone, speaking in a manner that's almost incoherent, with words that barely register. He then hangs up with agitation, muttering to himself as he retreats into his office, leaving Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace with dumbfounded expressions, their faces reflecting their struggle to comprehend the unfolding events. George, having just completed a task, is seen slipping a piece of paper into an envelope, an act observed by someone nearby. This observer makes an unexpected move, suddenly saying something surprising before reaching up to place a gentle kiss, leaving a trace of lipstick on his cheek. George, always the gentleman, opens the door graciously for her. 

As George and Violet move through the doorway together, they are subtly scrutinized by the attentive eyes of Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace, and the patiently waiting bank examiner, who is ready and eager to delve back into the books. Violet soon notices the lipstick mark on George's cheek and gently dabs it away with her handkerchief before making her graceful exit. As George reopens the door, he encounters Uncle Billy, who is frantically searching for the elusive envelope. The office is in a state of considerable disarray, with drawers pulled open and papers strewn haphazardly across both the floor and the desk, clear evidence of a frantic search effort. George comes to an abrupt halt, suddenly recognizing the deeply troubled gaze of Uncle Billy, who looks up at him with tragic, old eyes. Uncle Billy, with nervous gestures, beckons George to enter the room. George complies, closing the door firmly behind him to maintain a sense of privacy. Meanwhile, Cousin Tilly remains stationed at her switchboard, with Cousin Eustace standing close by, keenly observing the unfolding drama. 

In a sudden burst of energy and determination, the door flies open, and George strides out with clear purpose in his steps. He makes his way directly to the safe, searching with an intense sense of urgency, but unfortunately, his efforts yield no results as the elusive money remains unfound. Undeterred by this setback, he moves swiftly to the cash drawer within the counter, rifling through it in a final, desperate effort. Carter, steadfast and patient, remains standing in the doorway to his office, observing the proceedings with unwavering focus. Cousin Eustace quickly darts over to assist George. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy and George are seen retracing Uncle Billy's previous steps through the snow, meticulously searching every conceivable corner for the missing money. They pause momentarily on the sidewalk, sharing a brief but significant exchange as the gravity of their predicament weighs heavily upon them both.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Potter settles himself comfortably behind his desk, smoothing out the surface of the newspaper in front of him with deliberate care while muttering to himself under his breath, seemingly lost in thought or commentary. His attention is then drawn to an envelope resting on the desk, prompting him to examine it closely, peering inside to confirm that it contains money. Satisfied or perhaps intrigued, he turns his attention to his goon, silently gesturing toward the office door as if indicating a plan or command. With cautious curiosity, Potter partially opens the door, just enough to peer through the narrow gap into the adjacent bank, his eyes scanning the scene with a sense of vigilance. Suddenly, he begins patting his pockets with growing urgency, his movements becoming frantic as he searches for something missing, and his sense of panic intensifies. In his desperation, his eyes dart to the waste paper basket on the floor, checking its contents in hopes of finding what he seeks. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy is equally troubled, scanning his surroundings in a desperate effort to locate the missing money envelope. His face reflects a blend of puzzlement and deep concentration as he tries to piece together the situation, his concern steadily growing. Finally, a realization or decision hits him, prompting him to dash hurriedly through the door and out onto the bustling street beyond. As he crosses the street with urgency in the direction of the Building and Loan, the goon repositions Uncle Billy at Potter's desk, observing as Potter slips into a deep, contemplative state marked by a crafty expression. Concurrently, Uncle Billy moves with purpose across the street, his destination clear in his mind. At the same moment, George exits a room where he has recently concluded a meeting with the bank examiner, stepping out into an area where he spots Violet Bick waiting. Amid their encounter, a noise diverts his attention, drawing his gaze to Uncle Billy as he enters the office in a hurried, flustered manner. Uncle Billy's actions are frantic and distracted, as he picks up the phone, speaking into it without a clear sense of what he is saying, his agitation mounting. After he hangs up, he mutters under his breath, consumed by his thoughts as he retreats into his own office, leaving Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace staring after him in stunned silence. Meanwhile, George completes some writing task, methodically slipping the paper into an envelope, his focus momentarily interrupted by a peculiar comment from someone nearby. The interruption is accompanied by an unexpected gesture, as she leans in and plants a kiss on his cheek, leaving a visible trace of lipstick behind. George, taking the interaction in stride, steps forward to open the door for her as a gesture of courtesy. As George and Violet proceed through the doorway, their movements are observed by Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace, and the ever-patient bank examiner, who bides his time, eager to resume his review of the financial records. Violet, noticing the lipstick mark left on George's cheek, thoughtfully blots it with her handkerchief before making her exit. As George swings open the door, he is met with the sight of Uncle Billy, who is in the throes of a frantic search for the elusive envelope. The office is in disarray, indicative of Uncle Billy's chaotic search, with drawers left open, and papers scattered haphazardly across both the floor and the desk. George halts abruptly, struck by the sight of Uncle Billy's eyes, filled with a tragic, pleading expression that penetrates him deeply. Sensing the gravity of the moment, Uncle Billy gestures nervously, beckoning George to enter the room. George obliges, stepping inside and closing the door behind him to confer privately. Within the office, Cousin Tilly is stationed at her switchboard, with Cousin Eustace nearby, observing the developing situation. Suddenly, the door swings open once more, as George emerges with renewed purpose, striding confidently toward the safe, his intent to locate the missing money clear. Despite a thorough search, the money remains elusive, driving him to turn his attention to the cash drawer at the counter, scrutinizing its contents with no success. Carter stands patiently in the doorway to his office, awaiting developments. Recognizing the unfolding drama, Cousin Eustace rushes over to George. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy and George begin retracing Uncle Billy's recent steps, their path cutting through the snow as they methodically search every possible location where the money might have been misplaced. Their journey briefly pauses on the sidewalk, as they recalibrate their strategy in their quest to recover the missing funds.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Potter is at his desk, examining the newspaper and the envelope with money inside. He signals his goon toward the office door, opens it slightly to peer into the bank, and begins searching his pockets and wastebasket in increasing panic. Meanwhile, Uncle Billy is puzzled and concerned about the missing money. He rushes out into the street, heading toward the Building and Loan, while the goon returns Potter to his desk. Deep in thought, Potter wears a crafty expression.

Uncle Billy hurries into the office as George exits a room where he met with the bank examiner. George notices Violet Bick, hears a noise, and sees Uncle Billy entering, distractedly using the phone and then muttering as he enters his own office. Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace are left dumbfounded. George, having finished writing something and placing it in an envelope, receives a surprising kiss on the cheek from Violet, leaving lipstick. As George escorts her out, they're observed by Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace, and the bank examiner, who is waiting to examine the books. Violet notices the lipstick on George's cheek, wipes it off, and exits.

George enters to find Uncle Billy frantically searching for the missing envelope amidst a mess of scattered drawers and papers. Uncle Billy, with tragic eyes, gestures nervously for George to join him. George swiftly searches the safe and the cash drawer without success, with Carter still waiting by his office door. Cousin Eustace runs to George as he and Uncle Billy retrace Billy's steps through the snowy streets, desperately searching for the missing money, pausing momentarily on the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Potter, the influential owner of the local bank known for his ruthless business tactics, is now behind his desk. He spreads the newspaper, the Bedford Falls Gazette, out in front of him, muttering as he does so about the latest business news. He sees the envelope, looks inside at the money, a significant amount intended for an important transaction. Then, to his goon, indicating the office door with a sharp nod. Potter opens the door just a little, and peers through into the bustling bank where customers were busy with their transactions. He starts thumping his pockets, with increasing panic, and looks in the waste paper basket on the floor for the lost envelope. Uncle Billy, known for his absent-mindedness, looks around for the money envelope. He looks puzzled, thinks hard, then a look of concern creeps into his eyes as he realizes the gravity of the situation. He finally rushes through the door and out into the street lined with small-town shops and businesses. The goon wheels him back to his desk. He is deep in thought, with a crafty expression on his face, contemplating his next move. Uncle Billy is now running across the street in the direction of the Bedford Falls Building and Loan, a family-run institution struggling against Potter's vast enterprises. George, the kind-hearted manager of Building and Loan, is coming from the room where he has just left the bank examiner, a figure with the power to decide the future of the business. He sees Violet Bick, known throughout Bedford Falls for her vivid personality and colorful wardrobe, standing there. He hears a noise, and sees Uncle Billy entering the office. Uncle Billy comes hurrying in, visibly distressed. Uncle Billy picks up the phone and speaks distractedly, without knowing what he is saying due to his rising panic. He hangs up agitatedly, muttering to himself about the missing money as he goes into his own office. Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace, employees at the Building and Loan, look after him, dumbfounded by his behavior. George has just finished writing something, likely a note for the bank examiner, and is slipping the paper into an envelope. Violet looks at him, then says a strange thing, referring to the lipstick imprint she leaves when she reaches up and kisses him on the cheek. George opens the door for her, maintaining his gentlemanly demeanor. As George and Violet come through the door, they are being watched by Cousin Tilly, Cousin Eustace, and the bank examiner, an official tasked with ensuring the company's compliance with financial regulations, who is still waiting to go to work on the books. Violet sees the lipstick on George's cheek and dabs at it with her handkerchief, a lace-edged token she always carries. She exits, leaving a faint scent of her perfume in the air. As George opens the door again, he sees Uncle Billy frantically looking for the missing envelope. The office is in a mess, with drawers opened and papers scattered on the floor and on the desk, evidence of the chaos caused by the missing money. George stops short, suddenly aware of the tragic old eyes of Uncle Billy looking up at him, filled with desperation. Uncle Billy gestures nervously for George to come in. He does so and closes the door, shutting out the curious gazes from the office. Cousin Tilly is at her switchboard, connecting calls with practiced efficiency, and Cousin Eustace stands beside her, worried about the unfolding events. Suddenly the door opens and George comes striding out with determination. He goes directly to the safe, an old but secure relic, and starts searching, but doesn't find the money. Then he goes to the cash drawer in the counter and looks through it, hoping for a miracle. Carter, the bank examiner, is still waiting in the doorway to his office, scribbling notes on his clipboard. Cousin Eustace runs over to George, eager to help. Uncle Billy and George are retracing Uncle Billy's steps through the snow-dusted streets, looking everywhere for the missing money. They pause for a moment on the sidewalk, catching their breath in the crisp winter air, their minds racing with thoughts of what could have gone wrong.

Suddenly the door opens and George comes striding out. He goes directly to the safe and starts searching but does not find the money. Then he goes to the cash drawer in the counter and looks through it. Carter is still waiting in the doorway to his office. Cousin Eustace runs over to George. Uncle Billy and George are retracing the former's steps through the snow looking everywhere for the missing money. They pause for a moment on the sidewalk.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Potter is now behind his desk. He spreads the newspaper out in front of him muttering as he does so. He sees the envelope looks inside at the money. Then to his goon indicating the office door. Potter opens the door just a little and peers through into the bank. He starts thumping his pockets with increasing panic and looks in the waste paper basket on the floor. Uncle Billy looks around for the money envelope. He looks puzzled thinks hard. then a look of concern creeps into his eyes. He finally rushes through the door and out into the street. The goon wheels him back to his desk. He is deep in thought with a crafty expression on his face. Uncle Billy running across the street in the direction of the Building and Loan. George coming from room where he has just left the bank examiner. He sees Violet Bick standing there. He hears a noise and sees Uncle Billy entering the office. Uncle Billy comes hurrying in. Uncle Billy picks up the phone and speaks distractedly without knowing what he is saying. He hangs up agitatedly muttering to himself as he goes into his own office. Cousin Tilly and Cousin Eustace look after him dumbfounded. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Uncle Billy gestures nervously for George to come in. He does so and closes the door. Cousin Tilly is at her switchboard and Cousin Eustace standing beside her. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Barker is now beneath his hammock. He flings the magazine up above him, grumbling as he does so. He discovers the postcard, peeks inside at the stamps. Then, to his accomplice, gesturing toward the garden gate. Barker cracks the gate just a smidge, and gazes through into the bakery. He starts patting his shoes, with mounting alarm, and inspects the recycling bin on the bench. Aunt Margie glances around for the postcard. She looks bewildered, ponders deeply, then a look of worry creeps into her expression. She eventually darts through the gate and out into the meadow. The accomplice drags her back to her hammock. She is lost in contemplation, with a sly look on her face. Aunt Margie sprinting across the meadow in the direction of the Library and Bistro. Sam emerging from a nook where he has just left the librarian. He notices Betty June standing there. He detects a rustle, and sees Aunt Margie entering the garden. Aunt Margie comes bustling in. Aunt Margie grabs the megaphone and speaks absentmindedly, without realizing what she is saying. She hangs up nervously, grumbling to herself as she moves into her own garden. Cousin Lila and Cousin Archie observe her, bewildered. Sam has just finished sketching something, and is slipping the sketch into a pouch. He glances at her, then says an odd comment. She reaches up and taps him on the shoulder, leaving fingerprints. Sam pulls open the gate for her. As Sam and Betty June pass through the gate, they are being observed by Cousin Lila, Cousin Archie, and the librarian, who is still lingering to start on the garments. Betty June notices the fingerprints on Sam's shoulder, and brushes at it with her scarf. She departs. As Sam pulls open the gate, he sees Aunt Margie desperately searching for the absent postcard. The garden is in disarray, bins are opened, and tools scattered on the ground and by the hammock. Sam halts abruptly, suddenly conscious of the sorrowful old expression gazing up at him. Aunt Margie signals anxiously for Sam to enter. He does so and shuts the gate. Cousin Lila is at her typewriter, and Cousin Archie standing beside her. Suddenly the gate bursts open and Sam comes marching out. He goes directly to the vault and starts rifling, but doesn't find the stamps. Then he moves to the sugar jar in the pantry, and rifles through it. Dylan is still lingering in the archway to his nook. Cousin Archie dashes over to Sam. Aunt Margie and Sam are retracing her steps through the park, scanning everywhere for the absent stamps. They halt for a moment on the path.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Potter sits at his desk, examining the newspaper, and notices an envelope with money. He peers into the bank and starts searching frantically for the lost envelope. Uncle Billy, confused and concerned, rushes out to find it. Meanwhile, George sees Uncle Billy and, after dealing with Violet and a bank examiner, notices Billy's distress. George learns about the missing money and sees the chaotic office with papers scattered. Uncle Billy gestures for George to help, and after realizing the situation, George checks the safe and cash drawer, finding nothing. As Carter waits, Uncle Billy and George retrace their steps through the snow, desperately searching for the lost money.
